channel.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
channel.description:
So, I've ran out of things to do in my school, and I'm in 'love' with Adobe Flash Pro (I've got the beta for CS7 :D). So I've decided I'll make some assets for websites on here. They will be customizable by the user, i.e not me or another flash editor. I don't mean full fledged flash websites, they are ASSETS. Meaning bits and pieces, though, I'm sure you 'could' put them all together on a single page to make it a flash site. My first item is just about done. It's a customizable nav bar. You can edit almost everything. The only thing you can't edit is the actual background image for each icon (but you can change the color ;) ). It's all handled through XML. here's a line of the xml I used (clunky, in a way): [code=xml]http://www.google.com [/code] Here's a the description I've added in my xml document on what each does:
The only 'issue' that comes with this, is if I make the main image with rounded corners, if you extend it too far, the rounded corners start to stretch. [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/10dbcjr.png[/img] This image uses the xml i posted above. It's the first "LINK" them. If I set the variable TITLE to null (and it can be "Null", "NULL", etc. I made a check for that) it removes that one, and no more. And yes, you can change the digscusting bright green background. That's done here: [code=xml]00FF00[/code] My next project is going to be a youtube player.

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:33, topic:479537”]I avoided posting on this simply because almost every time you’ve posted in this board you become hostile towards people who give you constructive criticism and try to help you see the point.

Almost everything I’ve read in here has been true;

HTML5 does have pretty good animation
Flash is more or less dead, there’s no getting away from that. It’s very rare for any website developer to come across anything in flash and it’s even rarer to be asked to create something in flash. I respect that you spent time on making this and what not but you should research a bit to find out if what you’re using is deprecated or not.

If some of the best website developers this site has to offer are telling you the same story over and over again then it’s going to be true, you have to cut ties and accept it. Go make a replication of your program in another language, HTML5 for example.[/quote]
Well, I wouldn’t know how to even begin making this in html5. I know how to make a nav bar in html 5. that isn’t hard what so ever; but making a near-replica of this, where it’s all edited in xml, isn’t something I could just come up and do. I’ve been wanting to learn php, so I might take a crack at that now, but I’m still going to use Flash later on, I mean, that youtube player won’t be too shabby to have.

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I avoided posting on this simply because almost every time you’ve posted in this board you become hostile towards people who give you constructive criticism and try to help you see the point.

Almost everything I’ve read in here has been true;

HTML5 does have pretty good animation
Flash is more or less dead, there’s no getting away from that. It’s very rare for any website developer to come across anything in flash and it’s even rarer to be asked to create something in flash. I respect that you spent time on making this and what not but you should research a bit to find out if what you’re using is deprecated or not.

If some of the best website developers this site has to offer are telling you the same story over and over again then it’s going to be true, you have to cut ties and accept it. Go make a replication of your program in another language, HTML5 for example.

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:31, topic:479537”]The only time I ever see Flash used nowadays is to provide access to the clipboard from a webpage.[/quote]Never got the point of that. You must be really underestimating your users if you don’t think they’re capable of copying something. :S

EDIT:
I’d put adding a copy button under the same umbrella as making some links open in new tabs/windows. It should be the user’s choice whether they want to open something in a new tab or not (by middle clicking or right click > open in new tab).

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

The only time I ever see Flash used nowadays is to provide access to the clipboard from a webpage. :rolleyes: Other than that, animated games made like 5-10 years ago or websites that obviously haven’t grasped HTML5 yet…

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

@OP: Listen to these two fellows. You posted here wanting feedback, no?
There has been plenty provided. Avoid Flash.

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr”]You should also (almost) never use absolute positioning in web-design.[/quote]Yeah usually absolute positioning is used in small “sections” or applets. Something like a delete button positioned in an article.

[quote=“Bowser jr”]Make games and/or iPhone apps if you want to use flash and stay away from web-design (That you do not manage do to properly).[/quote]Making games in HTML5 is a better idea than using Flash. Even using something like GWT (Java library that cross complies to HTML5/Flash/Others) would be better. That way you can always provide a fallback.

Considering that was done half way through 2010, I'd certainly say it's gonna be phased out.

Just google html5 animation demonstration, there are hundreds.

Yeah and it’s only getting better.

I disable flash by default and had almost never needed to re-enable. It’s only used on older video streaming sites right now.

EDIT:
To OP, never, ever use flash for any important part of the website (navigation block, main article titles). It’s probably one of the worst usability things you can do and looks extremely amateurish. In the example you showed, an HTML/CSS version would be a lot cleaner looking and easier to manage anyway so I don’t really see the point in using Flash here to begin with.

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:27, topic:479537”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=597773.msg4208799#msg4208799 date=1359264363]
Back on topic, aside from everyone ‘hating’ on Flash, I think my idea is good.
[/quote]
No. CSS and HTML is superior for what you want to do. Your design doesn’t even look good. The standard Youtube player from youtube is superior to anything you can make. You should also (almost) never use absolute positioning in web-design. Don’t force the users to view your site in a certain size. Make games and/or iPhone apps if you want to use flash and stay away from web-design (That you do not manage do to properly).[/quote]
No, back on topic:

Jc22493:

Anyone who continues spamming and arguing after this post will be infracted.

Plus, I made this simply because I was bored. Oh, and how do you know how well MY player will be. You haven’t even seen the start of it, unlike youtube’s standard player, mine will load all the videos you tell it to, and play them in order, or you can click thumbnails of others that you have posted, and it will play those instead.

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:26, topic:479537”]Wait what?
http://webdesignledger.com/inspiration/10-html5-demos-to-make-you-forget-about-flash

Considering that was done half way through 2010, I’d certainly say it’s gonna be phased out.

Just google html5 animation demonstration, there are hundreds.[/quote]

The Wilderness Downtown

The Wilderness Downtown

Check out Arcade Fire's new interactive HTML5 music experience, “The Wilderness Downtown”.


I know, but it all looks pixel-lated and fake. Flash can deliver real-looking content, if done right.

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Back on topic, aside from everyone ‘hating’ on Flash, I think my idea is good.

No. CSS and HTML is superior for what you want to do. Your design doesn’t even look good. The standard Youtube player from youtube is superior to anything you can make. You should also (almost) never use absolute positioning in web-design. Don’t force the users to view your site in a certain size. Make games and/or iPhone apps if you want to use flash and stay away from web-design (That you do not manage do to properly).

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:479537”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=597773.msg4207624#msg4207624 date=1359154054]
Would advise against using/learning flash, it’ll be dead in a couple of years, better off getting to grips with html5.

edit: sorry, but I don’t see why this would be done in flash? All this can be done using one block element and some CSS attributes.

Looking forward to the youtube player though.
[/quote]
Flash isn’t going to die, not yet. Unless html pulls some serious animation out of it’s arse.
Honestly, I made it in Flash simply cause I’m bored in school.
And I’m having a couple ‘complications’ with the player, but it shouldn’t be too long.[/quote]
Wait what?

Web Design Ledger – 24 Jun 10

10 HTML5 Demos to Make You Forget About Flash - Web Design Ledger

You’ve probably been hearing a lot lately about how Flash is a dying technology and how it’ll soon be replaced by HTML5. Personally, I think that it will slowly replace Flash for some things, but Flash will always have a place, especially for...

Considering that was done half way through 2010, I’d certainly say it’s gonna be phased out.

Just google html5 animation demonstration, there are hundreds.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:18, topic:479537”]Because your not smart enough to tell me them. Usually, I wouldn’t point them out but I doubt you can even find them. Want me to tell you them (you’d be admitting you can’t find them by saying yes)?
HTML wont exist is how ever many years I stated, the odds of technology being stuck at a level similar to this are insanely low.
If you couldn’t care to argue, you wouldn’t respond.
I never stated whether html5 or flash is better (although my opinion is obvious anyways)…
You do have a judgement of me, everyone has a judgement of someone even from a brief one minute chat you will have an opinion. It may not be strong but it exists.[/quote]
Are you kidding me? I’m not smart enough to tell that you put don’t instead of doubt. Or of instead of off. Yeah, okay.
“most probably” wasn’t needed, the sentence should have been: No it wont be, in 100000 years it probably wont be supported…
You also missed a apostrophe in won’t.
You put to instead of “too”.
Oh, but I’m not smart enough to see any of these.
I’m sure there’s more, I just got lazy.
Plus, you are right, I do have a judgement of you, it just isn’t a proper one. It’s also whether I use that judgement against you or not.

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:16, topic:479537”]It’s a figure of speech lmao… (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figure_of_speech)
You caring if it is or isn’t doesn’t matter at all.
No it wont be, in 100000 years it wont be supported most probably (using your own technical thing against you just to emphasise how stupid that was although it doesn’t show much since what I said is fairly reasonable).
Sigh, it has a lot to do with this; do you want to explain that to or can you use the brain your lovely parents gave you?
You told me? That’s quite authorotive, shame you aren’t someone of power or authority. If you can give me a valid reason that is of course reasonable I will get of the topic. Simply because you don’t what I’m saying to you isn’t a good enough reason though. Throughout life you have to put up with people you don’t like and that doesn’t mean you should avoid them as that doesn’t resolve much.
I left a few flaws in their that aren’t grammatical, lets see if you can find them and call me out on them.[/quote]
Why should I waste the time to point out the obvious flaws you left there, when it has nothing to do with our discussion, explain that to me. Everyone makes mistakes, everyone has their flaws. Maybe mine is liking flash. I know “100000 years” is exaggeration, but you know, technology moves only so fast, and maybe in that time frame, HTML won’t exist anymore.
Oh, and I guess since you want a reason you should get off my topic. It’s cause I can’t care to argue, or discuss, which is better, Flash or html. Considering html5 is using more features that aren’t html itself, that’s an unfair judgement. It uses a lot of javascript, jQuery, and other languages. This has nothing to do with how I feel about you. I don’t hate you, I don’t like you, I personally have no judgement on you. I can’t call you a “good guy” or a “bad guy” because I only know you through some forums. That’s not a proper way to meet a person.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:15, topic:479537”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=597773.msg4208693#msg4208693 date=1359253456]

Reread my statement, you don’t seem to get what I said.

You said it’s not widely supported. Though, one of ‘the best’ browsers in the world supports it completely, I don’t get how it’s dying.

Thou shalt not use flash/java/plugin to make websites. It doesn’t matter if Flash had 110% penetration and would live on forever, it is horrible for web-design.

Thou shalt not be ignorant. Flash can be used perfectly in web design. It’s just up to the maker to have support on cross browsers.
[/quote]
No professional site uses flash for its design.[/quote]
I call bullshit. Disney and Intel both use flash on their sites.
http://disneyworld.disney.go.com/new-fantasyland/
http://www.intel.com/museumofme/en_US/r/index.htm

Flash is good for interactivity. Html can only do so much (without the help of other languages)

item.title: [Flash] Project Boredom [Flash]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:13, topic:479537”]“as it used to be”

Do you not understand how technology is changing? How big the mobile phone (cell phone) market is…? People are using Flash less than previously hence “as it used to be”. Their will be more stable better alternatives to Flash soon which will be popular and Flash will die.
God, why do I have to spell things out for you.[/quote]
Technically, you haven’t spelled ANYTHING out for me. I told you once, get off my topic.
I don’t really care if it’s “not as supported as it used to be”
It’s supported through PCs. and always will be.
They just decided to pull out of the mobile browser market. Though, that has NOTHING to do with this, considering I don’t see anyone playing a rsps on a mobile. Unless it was a tablet or ipad.
